p: MBC is expressed as the lowest concentration of essential oil where no visible growth on agar occurred. LEO tested on the G + group displayed a bacteriostatic effect, while on the G âˆ’ group it recorded results that were consistent with the MIC data recorded before: P. fluorescens showed an MBC of 7.50%, E. coli was 1.87%, and A. bohemicus was 0.47%; higher values of both MIC and MBC were obtained by using gen as a positive control ( Table 4).
